intro: Blaeria hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy blazer, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Blaeria hirsuta is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
